subject: Implement multi-project Studio infrastructure
description:
Based on research findings from Supabase GitHub discussions:
- Self-hosted Supabase is single-tenant by design
- Each project needs its own Docker stack (Studio, PostgREST, GoTrue, etc.)
- Supabase Cloud uses separate instances per project, the dashboard just unifies the view

Implementation plan:
1. Create dynamic Studio provisioning system
2. When project is created, spin up project-specific Studio container
3. Each Studio runs on unique port (3001, 3002, etc.)
4. nginx routes /studio/{project-slug} to correct Studio container
5. Remove old /studio/[slug] Dashboard page (replace with direct Studio access)

Technical approach:
- Add docker-compose override for per-project Studios
- Create API endpoint to provision Studio container
- Update nginx config dynamically with regex for /studio/{slug}
- Each Studio connects to its project's database via env vars

Files to modify:
- docker/docker-compose.yml: Add project-studio template service
- docker/nginx-studio.conf: Per-project Studio routing
- dashboard/src/app/api/projects/[id]/provision-studio: New API endpoint
- Remove: dashboard/src/app/studio/[slug]/page.tsx (no longer needed)
- Update components to link to /studio/{slug} directly

metadata.outcome: Multi-project Studio requires separate Docker stacks per Supabase research findings
metadata.next_steps:
1. Current solution: Shared Studio at /studio with /studio/{slug} Dashboard pages providing connection details
2. For true multi-project: Each project needs complete Docker stack (db, postgrest, gotrue, studio) on different ports
3. Alternative: Use pgAdmin or other DB tools that support multi-database management
